thread.title: Local Round Up: Omani instructor to conduct AFC course in Kolkata
thread.title_full: Local Round Up: Omani instructor to conduct AFC course in Kolkata

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Local Round Up: Omani instructor to conduct AFC course in Kolkata
text:
Local Round Up: Omani instructor to conduct AFC course in Kolkata Haroon Amour al Bartmani October 21, 2015 
Oman's Haroon Amour al Bartmani has been assigned by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) to conduct a goalkeeping course in Kolkata, India from November 1-8. 
A total of 24 coaches are expected to attend the seminar. 
Haroon Amour has extensive experience in both goalkeeper coaching as well as conducting seminars on behalf of the AFC. 
The seminar will feature both theoretical and practical sessions. 
The theoretical sessions, which will be held in the mornings, will cover coaching tactics, case studies as well as other fundamentals for goalkeeping coaching. Practical sessions, which will be held in the evenings, will cover medical, fitness and nutritional aspects of coaching. 
____ 
Percy Pereira retains veterans’ title 
Percy Pereira continued his fine form in the annual badminton tournament, organised by Indian Social Club (ISC) Muscat, by retaining the veterans' singles title on Monday. 
In the final, Pereira clashed with Yogesh Narula and secured a 21-6, 21-18 victory. 
____ 
Shahriar Fahim sets up easy victory for BDSM 
Shahriar Fahim claimed five for 34 as Bangladesh School Muscat (BDSM) wrapped up a comfortable six-wicket win against Indian School al Seeb (ISAS) in an Oman Cricket (OC) U19 junior division match that was played in Al Amerat recently. BDSM's Mahbub Hassan struck 52. 
Brief scores: ISAS 149 in 36.2 overs (Mohammed Faisal 77; Fahim 5-34) lost to BDSM 153-4 in 19 overs (Hassan 52, Abu Musah 38; Mohammed Taleeb 2-12). 
U16 division: Indian School Wadi Kabir (ISWK) 226-3 in 25 overs (Rohan Koshy 117 n.o; Indian School al Ghubra 196-9 in 25 overs (Mohammed Salman 111; Fletcher D’Souza 4-28, Koshy 4-20). 
U16-B division: Indian School Muscat 217-7 in 25 overs (Vikram Nabira 68; Mohammed Muzahir 2-21) beat Pakistan School Muscat (PSM) 131 in 19 overs (Ehsanullah 33; Mohammed Faisal 4-16). 
U13 division: ISWK 251-2 in 20 overs (Jeel 90, Amal Preet 77) beat PSM 95 in 19 overs (Abdullah Iftikhar 34; Yash Mehta 2-18). 
U13-B division: Gulf Cricket Club 168-3 in 20 overs (Rayyan Ghani 114 n.o) lost to BDSM 169-7 in 17 overs (Iftiak Hossain 86 not out); Shonak Kelkar 2-29). 
____ 
ISWK girls secures comfortable victory 
ISWK completed a dominating 41-run victory against Indian School Muscat (ISM) in an OC U19 girls' league match at Al Amerat recently. 
Brief scores: ISWK 184-0 in 20 overs (Akshandha 86 n.o, Jayadhanya 42 n.o beat ISM 143-6 in 20 overs (Sujana Sundar 54). Similar content
